turns: Dry cough and sore throat, no fever

raw.reply: Upper-respiratory symptoms are commonly mild and self-limited if no red flags.
raw.next_step: Self-care and monitoring are reasonable; recheck if not improving.
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.

turns: Crushing chest pain and shortness of breath

raw.reply: Your symptoms could be serious. Please call 112 or go to the nearest emergency department now.
raw.rationale: red_flags: chest pain + shortness of breath
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.

raw.reply: Severe sudden headache can be serious. Please call 112 or go to the ER.
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.

turns: I have hives and trouble breathing

raw.reply: Possible severe allergic reaction. Call 112 or go to the ER immediately.
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.

turns: My 2 month old has a fever

raw.reply: Fever in a baby under 3 months needs emergency assessment. Call 112 or go to the ER.
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.

turns: Burning urination with fever and back pain

raw.reply: Urinary symptoms with fever or back/flank pain need same-day care.
raw.next_step: Seek same-day urgent care or contact your GP today.
raw.disclaimer: Educational guidance only; not a diagnosis; not for emergencies. If this is an emergency, call 112.
